website_summaries.verdict: The best value for your money. An unbeatable deal for an entry-level drill press.
pros: Two-beam laser alignment system can make drilling much more accurate, particularly if you do a lot of repetitive work
cons: Some owners struggle with its assembly

website_summaries.verdict: The best budget option for a true drill press at a fraction of the cost of higher end options.
pros: Comes with a bright and clear laser beam for accurate hole placement before drilling
Depth stops keep the drill at a predefined drill depth
cons: Speed pulleys may start to loosen or degrade after long, continuous use during large projects

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is the last thing you'll get with this tool
customer_reviews.text: After reading hundreds of reviews on this Drill Press I figured for the price it would be worth trying, wrong answer, this drill press is cheap in price and in quality, the worst issue is the chuck wobble which makes the tool unusable for any kind of accurate work unless of course you like oval holes then it's perfect for you. Anyway I suffered with this junk for a year now I'm going to try and pawn it off for a few bucks so I can get a decent press. Bottom line if you need accuracy don't buy this press, you will be be extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: F. D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: My Ryobi is doing great. I gave it 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: The cast iron collar the mounts the table broke during assembly. I sent it back successfully using a tracking number and I have not heard back. NO refund, not nothing. I question the 5 star rating on this product. This was the second return for defective parts. My Ryobi is doing great. I gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Not Useless, Not Ideal
customer_reviews.text: This is a pure get what you pay for scenario. The laser is basically useless and adjusting takes an act of an unnamed diety. The table is unaligned and I can’t for the life of me figure out where I can adjust it so it squares. A non-standard chuck size makes bit changes slower but livable, the vibration is what is irritating as nothing stays in line. All that aside the machine works like a really steady hand held and for the occasional use where precision isn’t required it works, not a pro grade tool.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A. Matkin

customer_reviews.title: It does the job 👍
customer_reviews.text: So it’s a cheap drill press, lets get that out of the way. I use mine for light metal work and wood. It’s obviously not the most accurate press but once everything is mounted and tightened down it’s a good stable work platform. It would be nice if there metal pulleys and a built in belt tensioner instead of having to loosen the adjusters and reset the tension when you change speeds. For how much it gets used that is not a deal breaker though. When you get it take it all apart, clean the grease off everything, and re grease it all with some high quality grease. Relatively quite
customer_reviews.author: Bikelife570

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: If any kind of accuracy is required - this drillpress is not the tool to buy. I tried to square the drill bit to the table and found the cast iron table is warped. A straight edge does not lay flush on the table. The table does rotate to the right and left freely even with plenty of lubrication. This is a very poor quality drillpress.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy cheap drill press unless you have extra time to wait for a good one to come along
customer_reviews.text: I will today receive my 3rd drill , first was sent to me with the box and the drill smashed next I received a drill with what I will say was sent with what I'll describe as burned out motor today I'll receive the third ,hopefully this one will work. I would not recommend this drill press, unless you enjoy puting things together and taking them apart, more than drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Rendell Rainey

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have used this quite a bit with a 1-1/2" forstner bit in softwood and hardwood and it has worked very well. The only concern I have is that the spindles for changing speed are made of plastic where others in the same price range are metal. No problems so far but I will be watching for wear/damage. There are lasers to help align the work piece with the bit but the forstner bits are too big for the lasers to be effective. Overall, good tool for the money.
customer_reviews.author: The Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly table, otherwise solid.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the construction of the drill is pretty nice. However, the adjustable table itself doesn't tighten down properly, and so it wobbles from side to side, making it hard to drill precisely. There's little point in having a laser tell you where the drill bit will go, if there is half an inch worth of play on the table because the table support lock handle doesn't lock the table all the way down.
customer_reviews.author: Mostly Harmless

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the reviews, I believe that mine was a lemon. I found it underpowered even for simple woodworking tasks. Hard to change the speed etc. Now It’s just packed in working - humming but not drilling - and I hardly used it. For me it was a waste of money. 🙁
customer_reviews.author: Christopher O.

customer_reviews.title: Can't complete assembly
customer_reviews.text: One of the first steps in the assembly instructions says "1. Loosen set screw (2) in column ring (1) and remove the ring." Even after completely removing the set screw, the column ring is pressed so tightly on the column that I'm going to have to hammer it all the way off the column, potentially damaging it. This appears to be a common problem with this model, which I wish I'd know and could have purchased a different drill press. Really poor design, or manufacturing, or packaging, or maybe all three. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: donna j Rau

customer_reviews.title: Received Damaged; Packaging was fine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought an "open box" specimen of this product that purportedly had been "inspected" by Amazon. The inspector was either lazy or should get an eye exam, as the cast iron collar that supports the table was fractured into two pieces. Skil is sending a replacement part, since that's less trouble and expense than packing the whole thing back up for return. NOT as advertised, however. And not what I ordered or expected. I thought I'd bought a tool, but received a project instead. No question that this was already damaged and unusable when boxed and shipped.
customer_reviews.author: W. Thebert

customer_reviews.title: The MOST used tool in my workshop
customer_reviews.text: I am not one to write product reviews. However, as I am looking over my 5 year purchases from Amazon, I just had to pause to write. This tool is by far one of the best tools that I have worked with. I have now had it for about 5 years and use it almost daily. Sometimes, I would use it for as long as 6 hours nonstop in sanding. Very easy to use, quiet, durable and excellent performance. Because of how well this has worked over the years, I have basically only purchased Skil products to use in my woodworking studio, and I can say that I have been VERY pleased with each of them.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, have used it for everything
customer_reviews.text: So out of the box I set it in the lowest speed and I’ve used foster bits, drilled steel, used titanium and step bits. I purchased a Yost drill press vise and I m very happy with the purchase. I ve drilled up to 1/8th steel, but as long as you go slow with cutting oil I think it could handle any job. I was concerned about only having 2” of Travel but the base is adjustable up and down so it works fine. The motor is not huge so slow is the only way to use it for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Homeward

customer_reviews.title: Drill down to ACCURACY with SKILL:  (SKIL 3320-01 3.2 Amp 10-Inch Drill Press )
customer_reviews.text: The 3320-1 drill press with it's custom made stand is a great purchase for the money. Compact and well designed it would also work well on the workbench if you so choose not to purchase the custom stand which is very well constructed and very easy to assemble. Because we have mild working space issues, my son and I built a custom dolly with lockable casters for the stand provided so the drill press can be stored or moved around the shop with ease, according to needs of the project. WE LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Wild Bill from Bunker Hill

customer_reviews.title: It's junk. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've made the mistake of buying a product from Skil. Won't happen again. This thing is junk. The pulleys are plastic and poorly molded. They wobble and cause tons of vibration. The belt is also defective. It has a kink in it, so every time it goes around the pulleys, it causes vibration. The spindle has terrible runout as well as the included chuck. The quill has a terrible grinding feel to it and results in a jolting effect when drilling. I've tried multiple times to re-adjust the pressure on the alignment key with no success. I'll be returning this pile of s**t.
customer_reviews.author: Austin B.

customer_reviews.title: Great drill press!
customer_reviews.text: Great drill press! Do yourself a favor and purchase a 5/8” chuck and drill press vise.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DeMarr

customer_reviews.title: it's ok.
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem setting it up. the problems are: 1. to change the speeds you have to be careful not to pinch your fingers because there is not enough space to move the motor in. 2. once you knock the chuck in, you lose half the laser rays because the chuck is blocking the front of the laser lines just where they cross each other. bad design. 3. to fix it to the work table there are two holes that are so close to each other, it just does not make sense. apart from that the drill works fine. I will just have to see as time passes how it fares.
customer_reviews.author: Simcha

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous value
customer_reviews.text: I compared the specs of this to many different drill presses online, and I visited Home Depot, Lowes and Harbor Freight in-person to evaluate their offerings. In my opinion, this has tremendous value for the price. So far it has been highly capable, runs smooth, quiet and straight, and everything was of great fit and finish. The fact that the chuck goes down to darn near zero (I've held a #60 .040" bit in the chuck) just can't be found in other drill presses of this size and price. I would very much buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan T Kroh

customer_reviews.title: Quality is appropriate for the price
customer_reviews.text: Assembly of the drill press took much longer than expected. I was disappointed in the amount of wobble and the noise of the press when in the "up" position. When the chuck is lowered, the noise goes away. Still some wobble though. It does the job, but I wouldn't use it for frequent and heavy use. I considered returning the drill press, but decided not to, thinking that the quality is appropriate for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Paulsonn

customer_reviews.title: Mostly bummed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill to help get me through some aluminum and was disappointed that the drill seemed to be bogged down by the job. Granted, it’s not made for heavy jobs but I didn’t think I was asking much. I eventually packed it up and returned it. Went to my local Harbor Freight, spent slightly more, and got a drill press that could do the job. This drill may be good for wood projects but it doesn’t do much in the arena of even soft metals.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: No torque at all. Can stop with my hand
customer_reviews.text: I have been unsuccessful in drilling anything due to the fact that this drill press has zero torque. I set it to max rpm and was able to stop it with just my hand in a glove. I have not been able to drill anything because it just stops after getting started into the wood. 2x4 boards. Spend the money and get something of better quality. I just wish I didn’t wait so long to use this after buying it. Now I can’t return it
customer_reviews.author: Charlie VanDyke

customer_reviews.title: It wobbles and breaks thye bit
customer_reviews.text: do I have to say anymore I should have returned it I wont by this brand again and they make a good saw what happened?
customer_reviews.author: Oldman

customer_reviews.title: Numerous Issues
customer_reviews.text: After I filed the "sprawled" metal off of the end of the tapered, arbor shaft, and reinstalled the Jacobs-style chuck, it spins more smoothly. But I've purchased a new one to replace the cheap chuck! There is a lot of play in the rack & pinion gear assembly with no way to take out the "slap." So the windmill handle tends to shuck back and forth during use. The head stock and gear assby. became dry after just a few hours of use, causing it to seize. Had to disassemble and lube everything with silicone grease. Now it works just fine. And once I've replaced the cheap chuck with the new one it should be more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: MastaLappa

customer_reviews.title: This is a great drill press fit the weekend warrior on a budget
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill press fit the weekend warrior on a budget. I've been able to use this a number of times now over the past year and haven't had any issues. I've drilled through various types of hard and soft woods as well as high carbon metal without any issues. It's real simple to adjust the speed to accommodate whatever you're drilling. My only complaint is that there is a bit of a wobble to the stand when you raise and lower it. This is minor, but something to pay attention to in order to avoid drilling a whole into the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: No Column In Box!
customer_reviews.text: I received the package today, factory-sealed (only one layer of tape, plastic straps intact) - styrofoam packaging in bad shape, but everything in box was undamaged. It was, however, missing the entire column part. Base, work surface, motor, and accessories all there, but no way to put them together! I completely removed all packaging and checked inside motor, because I couldn't believe that such a big part could be missing! Will be sending back and purchasing a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but built to a price
customer_reviews.text: This drill press is built to a price. It is fine for drilling perpendicular holes, but there is a some runout and the hole size will always be larger than the bit. With a little trial and error, you can make a hole fairly close to the correct diameter. For example, if you wanted to make a 2.5 mm hole, you might need to use a 2.0 mm. Definitely not for precision work, but to be honest, what can you really expect for something that costs just a bit more than a good hand drill. Overall it looks nice, is very functional and serves a purpose.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelR

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy! This drill press turns "counter clockwise"?!?
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but after over an hour on hold to Customer Service, I've given up and am now warning any future buyers. Save your money and don't buy this drill press! It spins the drill bits "counter clockwise" instead of "clockwise". Please see the video and the picture of a "right-grooved" (most typical) bit, it has to be rotated clockwise!!! Like most folks, I only own right-grooved bits that spin "clockwise" in order for the bit of the drill to cut into the metal or wood. Hence, all the other customer complaints about this drill being "under powered" most likely are caused by the fact that their drills are also spinning "counter clockwise". Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Michael N.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged and looking refurbished. Otherwise would be great.
customer_reviews.text: Would have been 5 stars, but I received a unit with some dents (that somehow don't match up with the dents in the packaging, which were pretty big) and scratches around the engine casing and screw marks on the base stand. Almost makes me wonder if it was really a refurbished item. Amazon customer service did a great job getting a replacement sent to out me, I'm just a bit skeptical of the Skil brand after this.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGrower

customer_reviews.title: I can hold my hand on the  chuck and stop it from turning.  The belt is not slipping
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't cut a hole with a one inch hole saw. Pretty much worthless.
customer_reviews.author: JACQUES LAVAL

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall value of this tool. The only problem I had with assembly was the machining on the table that moves up and down on the main post. I spent 2 hours polishing the part that rides on the main post. I was fortunate that I had a Dremmel tool with small sanding drums.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on sale for $109, so for the price I couldn't ask for much more. I basically needed a drill press to center bore 5/8"x2" aluminum round stock. Although it proved to be a bit tricky, I figured out a way to do it. By drilling out a 5/8" hole in a piece of 1/2" aluminum flat bar and inserting the round into the hole, it held it perfectly in place to drill out a 1/4" bore directly down the center.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Too much runout for my woodworking projects.
customer_reviews.text: Took my time to assemble and square up everything only to find out what others have said, too much runout and no way to adjust. Not acceptable for my wood working projects. I fear there is nothing out there at this price point and compact size that will have lighter tolerances. Would rather them have spent money on better materials and not add the gimmicky laser.
customer_reviews.author: Texasbrock

customer_reviews.title: worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Decent little drill press but not great. For the money it was worth it. The worm drive mechanism used to raise and lower the work surface is somewhat wobbly - also, pay attention to how this is assembled. The instructions don't clearly point out which direction to put the slotted bar in. Finally figured it out by looking at the photo on the box. The laser cross hairs are a good idea but I could not align them accurately - just useful as a general reference, at least on my unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Snip

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and quiet
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this drill press is everything. Right height, easy to use and best of all it is quiet and does not vibrate. A nice drill press. Warning, it is a bit heavy which makes it more stable and you don't need to bolt it to a table. It's not going anywhere. Nice quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: JSW

customer_reviews.title: A great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a great size for my very small shop. Set up was simple, instructions are clear and easy to follow. It has enough power for hobbyist level tasks. This is the second Skil drill press I've owned; I let the first one get away from me and then discovered that I could really use one. I looked at several others but chose to come back to a proven product. It probably will be inadequate for any jobs that would normally be done on a floor mount drill press, but works great for smaller projects.
customer_reviews.author: cjstilwellrn

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and Better
customer_reviews.text: It was bigger and better than some of the other drill press I had look at in my search. It operates very smoothly and accurately and works very well for my needs. I am very happy with this drill press and hate that I waited so long to get one.
customer_reviews.author: Larry McClure

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drill Press at a bargain price! I love mine!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great drill press at an awesome price! I was amazed upon receiving the very well packaged unit which was very easy to assemble. I love the laser on it as it provides precise drilling and this is important to me as I build Guitar Tube Amps like they did back in the 50's and 60's. No printed circuit boards, everything I do is point to point wiring and I create my own "Turret Boards". Would I buy this again? Yes! Would I recommend this to a friend? Yes! Great product at an awesome price! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rain Photography

customer_reviews.title: Power Handling
customer_reviews.text: Drill Press does not have what is described as a 2 inch Depth Drill travel (less) need more turge to handle Hole cut saw cutter. I tried a 2 1/2 inch Diameter Cutter machine stalls. I am returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Home

customer_reviews.title: Go to tool
customer_reviews.text: I've used hand held drills all my life now I've found that I go to my drill press first. The laser has to be adjusted if you move the table or change drill bits so I don't use it.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: The Colette is too small and too difficult to press on, moreover the item was a previously returned item and the contents were just tossed into the box. I would flat tell you to avoid this item.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Gilliland

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. Laser is super handy, too. Assembly took a little grunt but nothing too crazy. Be advised that the speed is adjusted manually by changing the drive belt between gears, but the process is pretty quick and easy (with helpful charts printed on the case cover). I suppose that's why it's fairly cheap.
customer_reviews.author: C2

customer_reviews.title: Motor pulley angular misalignment...
customer_reviews.text: Motor pulley was factory made off center (angular misalignment). I have a dial gauge and tested the runout on the motor shaft (0.07mm) which was OK, however pulley was visibly wobbling. It made so much vibration I could see it in the bit. Throat is made of aluminum, it slides up and down in cast iron, it works but... Final analysis: if you get a good one the cheap price can help you overlook some issues, however for me the pulley issue was too much so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: -B

customer_reviews.title: Great little bench top press just one problem
customer_reviews.text: One laser light does not work and the other is no aligned. Was able to align the one that works but with one not working you have no cross hair. Can a new led be sent?
customer_reviews.author: John Bryant

customer_reviews.title: works really well for light duty applications
customer_reviews.text: The Skil drill press has served me well in the workshop for light duty drilling in wood blocks. Not meant for heavy duty use in terms of metals or other types of drilling that require variable speed, high torque operation but works really well for light applications. Sturdy and does not wobble around on the work table. Easy to setup and adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Dayzee D

customer_reviews.title: A great drill at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this drill for over a year now and have found it indispensable in my shop. The only complaint I have is the size limitation, which is understandable as it's a benchtop drill, but in hindsight I think I would have rather purchased a floor-standing drill press. As far as the fit and finish, it is high quality, solid, and accurate. the table and chuck were square out of the box, the table is flat, and the drill operates smoothly. I do wish that the table height adjustment were a little smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Cragun

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but the laser went out after 5 minutes, not that I need it but I did buy it with one !!!! would like to have it whether or not I need it.
customer_reviews.author: John Arbizu

customer_reviews.title: broken part
customer_reviews.text: came in with a broken table top support screw. no way to just replace that part so im going to have to spend money to get new one or return the entire order and deal with that headache
customer_reviews.author: Charles J.

customer_reviews.title: I love this little drill press
customer_reviews.text: I love this little drill press. Everything about it works very well and the belt speed changing is very easy. I have used it on several projects, nothing real heavy duty yet, and all is well. The laser came adjusted nearly perfect and is a big help. With the laser lines so far from perpendicular it would be nearly impossible to get it adjusted right on. The rack & pinion table height adjustment works very easy and smoothly. A great drill press for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Wengler

customer_reviews.title: Functional.
customer_reviews.text: The drill press arrived in working condition, but the main shaft that holds the drill is all covered in deep scratches. This does not affect the performance of the drill, but i did remove a star for not being brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Thor Allen

customer_reviews.title: My First Drill Press
customer_reviews.text: This is the first drill press I've ever owned and makes life much easier than using handheld drills. I'm not too excited about the laser beam for hole alignment but I don't use that anyway. The drill works very well and cuts accurately. I use it on slow speed for cutting wide holes and find that it works well on slow speed for all my drilling needs. I only use it for drilling wood so can't speak to how it does on metal. Great product and relatively inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Frank N. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this drill press for a few months now. Still works very well. The set up got a bit complicated but we got it. We will have this drill press for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: This drill came with a set screw that was inserted crooked and impossible to turn, I had to drill it out. It also came with a broken plastic thumb screw. I called the manufacturer and they did not have extras of the pieces I needed. I did not want to return due to size. It still does what it is supposed to do. Changing the belt is difficult, as the adjustment is limited in the distance it can travel. It's meant to be a cheap press, it's fine for my purposes (drilling holes in PCBs), but it has left a bad taste in my mouth for Skil products.
customer_reviews.author: Randy S.

customer_reviews.title: It's a good toy, not for any precision drilling.
customer_reviews.text: The base is off by a few degrees and only swivels side to side. It's not much of a problem if you're drilling wood but it's definitely not up to par if you're planning on having any precision drilling. I purchased a swivel vice to try to hold things straight and level but it didn't help much as it still flexes a tiny bit. You can't really expect much for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is good enough for my needs, which are mostly drilling out pen blanks and similar items that I use on my lathe.
customer_reviews.author: FOSTERBDAV66

customer_reviews.title: 4 out of 5 ain’t bad.
customer_reviews.text: Box was damaged, there is a small dent on the top of my drill press, fortunately not effecting the operation. That’s the reason why I give it four stars instead of 5. Appears to be very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Missing worm drive that raises and lowers the deck. Might be missing more parts but this is the second item I got from skil today for my birthday and its missing pieces. So the virus caused me not to celebrate my birthday with friends and skil finished ruining it by shipping 2 items both missing parts. Thanks for nothing skil.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Husband
customer_reviews.text: My husband adores this toy and is very pleased with it. That's the extent that I can review it.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenixique

customer_reviews.title: well researched and purchased from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Great product--quality exceeded my expectations--well packaged--quality all the way-easy assembly and no adjustments were required--directions well written --I compared with most similar products offered before buying and I have the skills and experience needed to assess the various products available--this is not a production or precision tool but will serve home shop needs very well. I would recomend this tool withour reservation. I have an opinion the very few really bad reviews may be posted by competative product sellers.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Decent little hole puncher!
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these a couple years ago for my shop. I do mostly metal work...and this little drill press is surprisingly effective! I've had zero problems with it. Use it to drill holes for a bunch of stuff...mounting scopes...holes for rivets in ak-47 receivers...various small repairs on firearms. Now...here's the deal...this drill press is not for ass scratchin' precision. Go buy a mill if you need that. However...if you just want a simple, reliable, inexpensive hole puncher....this one will do nicely. Although...I think I only paid $114 for mine...ehh..
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: VERY HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: Nobody could believe this was $113 drill press. We had to drill 150 pipes. We made 2 teams of 6 people feeding, drilling, and unloading pipes. We easily beat the 2nd team that was using a professional machine shop drill press by a ratio of about 3:1. Thanks to others about their tip on mounting the pole as per the picture on the box, instead of the as per the directions. This was for a home, amateur use, so I can't comment on the precision of the device. More later.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Life 2018

customer_reviews.title: great price for a great drill press
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great price. Easy to assemble and use. One thing to mention is the laser alignment. You can adjust it, but be VERY careful how tight you set the screw to lock it in. As you tighten the screw, the laser will move slightly (annoying but not the end of the world). In my case I tightened too much and it crunched the housing and now... no laser. Bummer, but it was my fault. The system to align the laser is not that great, but otherwise this is a fantastic product hands down. Easy to rate 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JVDUB

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I've got a bigger drill press, but I actually wanted a smaller, second one. This is one steady, quiet, precision machine! I know that the instructions say that I'm supposed to bolt it to my worktable, but I haven't found that to be necessary. I appreciate the fact that someone thought a laser would make my day, but for me it's a needless distraction. The fact that I bought so much engineering and material for so few dollars still baffles me. Don't tell SKIL, but it's a bargain at double the price. Couldn't be happier. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John W. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: It was returned and replaced at no cost to me and the replacement is a very good drill press
customer_reviews.text: An acceptable drill press for the money, though one is well advised to inspect thoroughly upon receipt and once assembled "check" that the spindle and chuck are rotating accurately. The first of these delivered was unacceptable; the thing would not produce a round hole because the spindle was either bent or not assembled properly even though the chuck was square on the shaft. It was returned and replaced at no cost to me and the replacement is a very good drill press.
customer_reviews.author: rma

customer_reviews.title: Okay for light duty work as long as it keeps working.
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because this drill press is very usable for light duty work when it works. Mine stopped working and it looks like the run capacitor is faulty or the motor is shot (it just buzzes). I switched it off, repositioned the wood for the next hole and it didn't turn on anymore. Hope it is the capacitor and service agrees to send me one. I bought it less than 2 months ago and used it for about 100 holes.
customer_reviews.author: DeVerm

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little drill press for a home workshop
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little drill press for a home workshop. It's easy to assemble, and most parts are heavy-duty and solid. One nylon handle cracked on a bolt that locks in the belt tension the first time I used it, but I can easily replace the bolt with an all-metal bolt and head. In the meantime, I can tighten the bolt with a pair of pliers. The drill press itself is easy to operate and adjust. The laser guide is accurate and makes precision drilling a snap. This machine is clearly not industrial or professional quality, but it's a great addition for an amateur's workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Rev Lawrence Keeler

customer_reviews.title: ... woodshop for a year or so and couldn't be happier. It has enough power for any job I've ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this in my amateur home woodshop for a year or so and couldn't be happier. It has enough power for any job I've thrown at it, as long as I don't try to take it too fast. Drills straight and consistent holes too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Very Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Great for non-accurate work. Workmanship is terrible. Cheap Chinese built. Spend a little more and get a better quality machine
customer_reviews.author: Lyle K.

customer_reviews.title: For the money it seems like a very good drill press
customer_reviews.text: For the money it seems like a very good drill press. I only have two issues with it. First is the table has a little to much side to side motion, even when it is completely tightened down. Second is the belt is very hard (at least I found on mine) to adjust when set at the lowest speed. To be honest I really don't plan to use it other then the lowest speed. I have found that the slower the drill press is running the longer my drill bits last. Laser wasn't exactly perfect but was very easy to adjust. Seems to have plenty of power and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great drill press for your hobby bench, or shop
customer_reviews.text: It is built very well, and made to last. The laser pointer can be turned on and off, and is very accurate. If you don't think it is, you can adjust it. What can be better than that? It's speed is changed by adjusting the pulley belt under the top cover. I bolted an Irwin vice to it with 3/8" bolts, washers and wing-nuts, and I love it all. I think the only other thing I will add is a bright light on my work. With all the LED lighting options, I'm sure that will be easy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I looked around the net for months trying to decide on a benchtop drill. A lot of sites had this as the best value. So far i have been very impressed. For a little over $100 its perfect for the hobbyist. I drilled some mortises and used a hole saw, drilled aluminum and so far it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: cmj4979

customer_reviews.title: This tool is great for the money
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great for the money..Skil tool has been in business for 80 plus years, even thou I believe Bosch now owns them. This drill setup is heavy and solid...Takes about twenty minutes to put together..but is a snap for the qualified home owner...I am still amazed it weighs over a hundered pounds....takes 2 to get it on your bench..if you are a retired old fart like me.....
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon's replacement was quick and easy even after 30 days because of a Christmas order
customer_reviews.text: First unit had spindle out of alignment. Amazon's replacement was quick and easy even after 30 days because of a Christmas order. 2nd unit runs true and is well made. Should last my son a long time maybe till he's my age.
customer_reviews.author: 22Diva

customer_reviews.title: multi-speed pain
customer_reviews.text: I put this together last night and am pretty happy with it. For the price, it's great. Heavy unit! Assembly is fairly involved but very doable for anyone with half a brain and the patience to read directions. I do think that switching speeds is quite the rigamarole, and sortof wish I'd just paid a little more for a model that could do this with the flip of a switch. But for this price, it's a great option.
customer_reviews.author: seagoat8888

customer_reviews.title: It's a cheap drill press. It's okay for very light work.
customer_reviews.text: Works okay for minor bit drilling in thin material. Dont count on it for boring even small holes with hole saws in hardwood. Even on slowest setting it bogs down.
customer_reviews.author: Sincerely

customer_reviews.title: An Inexpensive Benchmounted Drill Press.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is everything I expected. I mounted it to my workbench and it drills accurate holes, much better than a hand drill, and that is why I bought it. Changing speeds is done switching belt pulleys. Laser guide is OK not real bright but I use a Magnifying Lamp when I drill so do not use it much. It is very quiet and easy to set up for 'small projects' due to the vertical travel limitations. You need a Floor Mount Press for 'large projects'.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart W. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly right out of the box. This is just what I needed in my little shop making little wooden boxes and such. I needed more accuracy and repeatability than a hand held drill could give and anything more would be overkill. Multi speed, accepts a ton of bits and quiet. It is a lot heavier than it looks. Glad I don't need to move it around.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: I have owned one of these drill presses for close ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned one of these drill presses for close to seven years. It's suitable for my purposes and the price was within my budgetary requirements. I'd buy another without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Babalooie

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good drill for small projects, did not fit my needs in a wood shop where I needed more power
customer_reviews.author: T. Rienstra

customer_reviews.title: For the price there isn't much to a drill press but its stable bores straight and is easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and didn't expect that much but I was pleasantly surprised. For the price there isn't much to a drill press but its stable bores straight and is easy to adjust. I can't say its a work horse the one time I had a bit of work to do I needed to pause as the engine did get vary hot after about an hours worth of work and I didn't feel like melting it down for scrap. Took a while for it to cool but great for simple drill holes you need placed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad small drill press for the money. This is said to be made by Skill, which is owned by Bosch. However, this is one of many clones that all come out of the same Chinese factory - regardless of brand name glued onto it. You get what you pay for. And for around $100 it is a fair deal. But is is NOT a $250 to $300 bench top drill press by any means, regardless of the Skill, Bosch name plate.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: this is not a pro machine, but it is a fine hobbyist's machine. easy to assemble, and solid enough to set up a jig for repeatable drilling. a good buy, indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Glen Krueger Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great little drill press
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been great. It's accurate, has handled forstner bits like a champ, it easy to use and setup, and I have to complement Skil's customer service. My table came warped and with a crack in it and even though the press is on backorder they made everything right.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill press for the home shop
customer_reviews.text: The is a pretty good drill press for the money. Which is expected from a company such as Skil. it's well constructed and the parts are properly deburred and well fitting. The step pulleys are a composite material, which may prove to be a problem long-term. But for now they're working just fine. The table rotates easily around the main tube and adjusted up or down equally with ease. It's a winner in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: ColdinMN

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy jobs.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice drill press for light work. It doesn't have enough power to bore holes in ard wood. It begs down easy.
customer_reviews.author: Lauradelius

customer_reviews.title: Will do in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: This is probably all the drill press I need, but it is underpowered for some applications. Great for drilling small holes, but bogs down with larger diameter Forstner bits. I managed to make it work, and can't imagine spending the money or taking up the space for a full size drill press, but you should recognize this is NOT a substitute for the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: K. C. Ramsay

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: So I took the plunge on this since it had such great reviews and bought from Amazon saving a few bucks over the local store cost. I am not disappointed. Received yesterday and set it up in about a half hour. Everything feels strong and operates smoothly. The instructions were easy to follow and the features are great. It is surprisingly quiet and compact, too! Great tool that I hope to use for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: S. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is easy
customer_reviews.text: Great drill press, breeze to Assembly, the only thing the Laser does not work replaced batteries with new still no go, to much trouble to send back i will keep it
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome drill press for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome drill press for the price. Assembly was simple and once you tighten all bolts everything feels very solid. I use it every now and then and don't require much precision, so this is perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Matt N

customer_reviews.title: Good little drill press
customer_reviews.text: Works like I thought it would. Easy set up, well packaged. Not too heavy to move if I need to, the laser thingy is dead on. I only really use it for mortise and tenon joints so it does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Christian L.

customer_reviews.title: Was described in detail, was delivered fast, very useful
customer_reviews.text: Used it the second day, strong motor, perfect for what I needed for. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bazan

customer_reviews.title: Does not assemble correctly, but is functional
customer_reviews.text: See those three spokes sticking out of the big knob on the picture? The ones that help you raise and lower the drill head? They don't fit. The holes drilled in the knob are too small. Not the end of the world, but frustrating. I told customer service about it, and they sent me more spokes - same size. Does not fix the problem, obviously. I have gotten by with just turning the knob by hand without the leverage added by the spokes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: True to reviews
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Haven't measured but very little runout compared to what I've seen and meets is true to the positive reviews I've read.
customer_reviews.author: eraid0

customer_reviews.title: Great drill press at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a month now and I love it. Solidly constructed, aligned, .001" runout on the chuck (measured with a dial indicator), it was ready to go after 20 minutes of assembly. The only thing I'd change is to have a way to tilt the table without having to loosen a bolt with a wrench. Other than that, it's exactly what I want and at $113 was a bargain. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P. McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: It's good.
customer_reviews.text: Fine little drill press for light to medium duty work in the shop. Just what I needed and at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: mark tucker

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It would be fine for the lightweight occasional work that i do, but my biggest gripe is that the table cannot be locked. I tighten it until I'm afraid it's going to break, but the table always rotates. It is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: The laser does not work and the switch was hanging and has a part missing that should hold it in place. I will change my rating if they send me the parts to fix the laser.
customer_reviews.author: Jim perry

customer_reviews.title: Great Weekend Warrior Press
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drill press to help with wood and metal projects and I have been very very pleased with it. Works like a champ. Clean straight holes. My only complaint is I wish there were more more distance between the back post and the center of the chuck for drilling holes farther from the edge of the work piece. But that's not the drill's fault. Drill performed wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was on sale and was too good to pass up. It's my first drill press, so I can't compare it to much, but it works very well for my limited needs. I can tell that the quality of construction isn't the greatest, and the measurement markings and system aren't top-notch but I don't expect them to be for the price I paid. I think this is the perfect drill press for my limited needs and usage.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: Plastic pulleys make it trash.
customer_reviews.text: The pulleys are plastic. One of them wasn't tightened from the factory. Tightened it on first usage when it started spinning on the shaft immediately. Drilled 72 3/16 holes before the belt wore through on the motor/drive side from being out of alignment with the driven pulley and it became unusable. The plastic pulleys are trash and I can't find a replacement. The bean counters chose a plastic pulley to save money. What a rip.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Several important parts missing. Customer Support was unacceptable. Ship the whole unit back at a cost of as much as the whole thing. There is no warranty on this unit, despite what is written. You get what you pay for is the order of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: SKIL 3320-01 3.2 Amp 10-Inch Drill Press
product_meta.description:
Style:Drill PressSkil Benchtop Power Tools are Quality Tools at a Great Price.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Skil Benchtop Power Tools are Quality Tools at a Great Price !
feature_bullets: 1/2-Inch keyed chuck. Bump-off switch for added safety
Adjustable depth stop for accurate measurements and repetitive drilling
Laser X2 2-beam laser for precise hole alignment

specifications.Warranty Description: 1 year warranty/30 day money back guarantee
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars775 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
